---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: In other places, e.g. [LinearEquiv.arrowCongr](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/Basic.html#LinearEquiv.arrowCongr) we do this as a single equiv. Do you think we should do that here as well?

I don't really have an opinion on this. I feel like in most cases it would only get more cumbersome. On the other hand Mathlib seems to agree with you in general, so since it doesn't change the defeqs I think I'm going to do what you suggest.
Done. I'm not quite sure about the naming though.

:v: ADedecker can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9164718861/job/25196586412)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9164718861/job/25196585284)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9164718861/job/25196585750)

Looking through the library I think this is the standard name. 
```suggestion
protected def _root_.Homeomorph.arrowCongr (φ : X ≃ₜ Z) (ψ : Y ≃ₜ T) :
```

I was going to use it but figured it would sound a bit weird for the uniform version since `ContinuousMap` are not the arrows in the category of uniform spaces. But oh well, consistency is more important.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: congruence homeomorphisms for ContinuousMap

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: golf SpectrumRestricts.closedEmbedding_starAlgHom using uniform trickery

nodes.body: In other places, e.g. [LinearEquiv.arrowCongr](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/Basic.html#LinearEquiv.arrowCongr) we do this as a single equiv. Do you think we should do that here as well?

I don't really have an opinion on this. I feel like in most cases it would only get more cumbersome. On the other hand Mathlib seems to agree with you in general, so since it doesn't change the defeqs I think I'm going to do what you suggest.
Done. I'm not quite sure about the naming though.
